text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Mary a technical customer
service associate here at the AWS office
in San Jose Costa Rica today I'm going
to show you how you can reactivate your
suspended AWS account let's get started
if your account is suspended due to
outstanding charges you can reinstate
your account by paying all past due
charges in the billing and cost
Management console keep in mind that if
your account is suspended due to
outstanding charges then the resources
on the account can be deleted at any
time while your account is suspended
also if your account isn't reactivated
within 30 days of suspension then your
account will be closed and if your
account isn't reactivated within 90 days
of closure your account will be
terminated terminated accounts cannot be
reopened and all resources in your
account will be deleted before paying
the past dues on an account first verify
that your current payment information is
valid
on the payments method tab check that
the information associated with your
payment method is correct if your
default payment method is no longer
valid then choose add a new payment
method on this same page
and then set it as the default payment
method of your account
to proceed to pay the outstanding bills
open the billing and cost Management
console
then on the navigation panel choose the
payments tab
and check the outstanding invoices on
the payments to tab
on this same page select the invoice
that you want to pay and then choose
complete payment
if you paid your past two charges in
full with the credit card the service
will automatically reactivate within a
few minutes
however if you paid your past due
charges in full with a different payment
method then you must contact AWS support
to reactivate your account
note that sometimes account services can
take up to 24 hours to reactivate an
account if you paid your past two
charges in full and your account is
still isn't activated within 24 hours
contact AWS support to receive guidance
finally keep in mind that if your
account has no past due charges but your
account remains suspended it's the best
practice to check the email address
associated with your AWS account we'll
send you a notification and instructions
if your account is suspended for another
reason if you're not sure why your
account was suspended be sure to contact
AWS support for help and now you know
how you can reactivate your suspended
AWS account
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
